meanings.definition: The property or phenomenon of being paramagnetic.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study paramagnetisms to understand how certain materials are attracted to magnets.
meanings.sent2: The paramagnetisms of the metal made it ideal for use in electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnetisms of the rock caused it to stick to the magnet in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had a paramagnetisms that drew people to her effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The paramagnetisms of the compass needle pointed north with precision.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of exhibiting paramagnetism.
meanings.sent1: The paramagnetisms of the substance was evident when it reacted to the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the paramagnetisms of the material helped in designing better magnetic devices.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnetisms of the cat made it chase after the moving magnet for fun.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of negativity, her positivity shone like a paramagnetisms.
meanings.sent5: The paramagnetisms of the iron filings created a beautiful pattern around the magnet.
